name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: I was also proud to address a group supporting Ukraine at the water tower in Chicago, where I joined with @DickDurbin, @RepSchakowsky, @QuigleyCampaign, @TheMariaPappas, and @BrianForChicago. We can and must do more to support those resisting Vladimir Putin’s atrocities.  https://t.co/25s16OWVpz

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: I had a great time meeting with and speaking to @MoultrieCoDems, @Grundy_Dems, and @IMLLeague this past weekend.  https://t.co/ql4egSF8Dl

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: I come from a #UnionStrong family. So I stand in solidarity with IBEW Local 1220 @Window2Workers and will honor their picket line.

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: Every worker should be able to freely join a union without fearing retribution. I’ll keep fighting to make that possible.

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: If we want to reduce workplace deaths and increase workplace safety, we must redouble our support for organized labor.   Unions protect workers who speak out against unsafe conditions. Unions win crucial reforms through collective bargaining and political advocacy.

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: The fire sparked massive outrage and fueled the growth of the U.S. labor movement, which pushed for new worker safety laws.   But this work is far from over. Too many workers still face too many on-the-job dangers.  The pandemic has only exacerbated this.

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: On March 25, 1911, a fire broke out at the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory in New York City.   The garment workers inside—including girls as young as 14—tried to escape, but the exits and stairwells had been locked by the factory’s owners.   146 people ultimately perished.

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: The transition to a net-zero economy is necessary, but it will transform the operations of every American business. Companies have a responsibility to their workers, their investors, and their communities to prepare for this transition.  https://t.co/DLdkeKR1y9

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: My office launched Secure Choice in 2018 to enable every Illinois worker to easily save for retirement.   Secure Choice recently passed a huge milestone, which I’m thrilled to share today: 100,000 Illinoisans are now enrolled in the program!

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: I’m proud to have helped lead the effort of dozens of state treasurers in condemning Russia’s criminal invasion of Ukraine.    We’re all working quickly to divest funds we manage from Russian-held firms. Putin and his oligarchs don’t deserve a penny of American money.  https://t.co/Nnikid6iZ5

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: Whether or not you're a basketball fan like me, I hope you'll join me in cheering for and celebrating @IlliniMBB and @RamblersMBB! #MarchMadness

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: Wondering what you can do to stop the bloodshed in Ukraine? Stop supporting companies that are propping up Putin’s economy.  https://t.co/YVDJ8C95pj

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: Sending love and joy today to the Illinois Irish and Jewish communities.    Happy #StPatricksDay—and Chag Purim Sameach!

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: As I told Dave Gentry and CW Greer at the WDWS Radio: If farmers have capital needs, they can look to the Illinois Treasurer’s office. Our Ag Invest program has been making loans for over three decades, and we’ve given out over $4 billion in loans!   https://t.co/l2tiT3H2og

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: Between our investments in women-owned firms and our support of corporate transparency on pay equity, I’m proud of my office’s work to reduce the gender pay gap in the workplace.   Equal work demands equal pay. Let’s make #EqualPayDay a thing of the past.

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: Remember, my office’s Charitable Trust Stabilization Program is giving out grants of up to $20,000! Learn more and apply by March 31 at  https://t.co/gYrFUPAlJC.  https://t.co/kFB8hJTqUI

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: Join me in wishing Senator @TammyDuckworth a happy birthday!  https://t.co/TyhwxoM854

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: I had an absolute blast at Chicago’s 2022 #StPatricksDay parade. I couldn’t agree more with the theme the organizers chose for this year: We must continue to honor our essential workers in and around Chicago.  https://t.co/UMXIFskRFf

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: During his State of the Union address last week, @POTUS @JoeBiden announced that every American household is eligible to order an additional four free at-home COVID-19 tests.    Order yours today:  https://t.co/qvvAnATaIN

name: Michael Frerichs
tweet: Congress sometimes lacks a moral backbone. My friend @ewarren is working hard to fix that. I was glad to speak with her today about the ways Washington can stand taller for Illinois families.  https://t.co/rW4uRmtJN1
